required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ECLS Versus IMPELLA™ as Bridge to LVAD (ECI-BLAD)
clinical_study.official_title: ExtraCorporeal Life Support (ECLS) Versus IMPELLA™ Pump as Bridge to Left Ventricular Assist Device

brief_summary.textblock: In this retrospective observational multicenter study the authors tested the hypothesis that the use of IMPELLA™ pump as bridge to bridge, by giving the opportunity of active rehabilitation, should improve patient's outcomes after the implantation of Left Ventricular Assist Device (LVAD).

detailed_description.textblock: End stage heart failure patients admitted in Intensive Care Unit (ICU) for refractory cardiogenic shock requiring short-term mechanical circulatory support as a bridge to a long-term LVAD might benefit from early mobilization and rehabilitation with IMPELLA™ inserted via the axillary artery. The aim of this study is to compare the early rehabilitation and outcomes after LVAD implantation between patients previously treated by IMPELLA™ or ExtraCorporeal Life Support (ECLS)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients alive in the surgery ward, not requiring intravenous access and walking (John Hopkins highest level of mobility (JH-HLM) scale = 8 at 30 days after the LVAD implantation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 30 after Left Ventricular Assist Device (LVAD) implantation
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients alive in the surgery ward, not requiring intravenous access and walking (John Hopkins highest level of mobility (JH-HLM) scale = 8) at 30 days after the LVAD implantation

secondary_outcome.measure: Complication and rehabilitation under Short-term Mechanical Circulatory support
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The day of Left Ventricular Assist Device (LVAD) implantation
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of support, bleeding, hemolysis, surgical re-exploration, thombus, renal replacement therapy, blood products transfusion, stroke, tracheal extubation, mobilization (chair, walking and ergometry)
Need for mechanical ventilation, Organ dysfunction assessed by Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score [0= best outcome to 24 = worst outcome]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The day of Intensive Care Unit (ICU) discharge
The day of Short Term Mechanical Circulatory Support (STMCS) implantation
secondary_outcome.description: Organ dysfunction assessed by Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score [0= best outcome to 24 = worst outcome]
Organ dysfunction assessed by Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score [0= best outcome to 24 = worst outcome]
Organ dysfunction assessed by Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score [0= best outcome to 24 = worst outcome]
Organ dysfunction assessed by Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score [0= best outcome to 24 = worst outcome]
Organ dysfunction assessed by Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score [0= best outcome to 24 = worst outcome]
Organ dysfunction assessed by Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score [0= best outcome to 24 = worst outcome]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to Intensive Care Unit (ICU) discharge (not more than 6 months after LVAD implantation)
secondary_outcome.description: Intensive Care Unit length of stay

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to hospital discharge (not more than 6 months after LVAD implantation)

arm_group.arm_group_label: IMPELLA™ alone as bridge to LVAD
arm_group.description: patients assisted by IMPELLA™ pump alone during the days preceding the implantation of long term LVAD (at least 48 hours for patients for whom an ECLS was previously used)

arm_group.arm_group_label: ECLS alone or with IMPELLA™ as bridge to LVAD
arm_group.description: patients assisted by ECLS (ExtraCorporeal life support) alone or simultaneously with IMPELLA™ until the implantation of LVAD

intervention.arm_group_label: ECLS alone or with IMPELLA™ as bridge to LVAD
IMPELLA™ alone as bridge to LVAD

study_pop.textblock: consecutive patients implanted by IMPELLA™ pump or ECLS as a bridge to long duration LVAD between January 2012 and December 2018 in five university hospital centers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients supported with IMPELLA™ or ECLS for refractory cardiogenic shock as a bridge to long duration LVAD
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient refusing to give access to their medical chart
- Guardianship and curactorship
- Deprived of liberty
- short term mechanical circulatory system weaned before LVAD implantation
